posts.cooked:
I think this feature should be given a high priority. Currently when your driving and get a call the screen will distrub everything on it and the only way to answer or reject is swiping the phone button. This is not very safe and not user friendly.

At the very least we need to be able to answer or reject calls with the steering wheel control and have the call routed to bluetooth. And hopefully also provide some sort of car mode or android auto integration where the call wont take up the whole screen.

Click LIKE if you want this feature

link_counts.title: No longer picks up in car from Steering button

posts.name: Johanw666
posts.cooked:
This is actually quite difficult, I looked into this when I worked on a similar product. You need to fake an incoming ‚Äúreal‚Äù phone call to control these controls correctly. For headsets with one button this can be done with knowledge about the call state of the app, but for headsets with 2 buttons I found there are only 3 difficult solutions:

  1. Use some Android API, but since some Android 2.x version this can only be done by system apps and installing Signal as a system app seems unlikely.
  2. Use reflection to hack into the private Android classes. This is probably error prone and maintenance heavy.
  3. Use low-level Bluetooth sockets to communicate with the headset or carkit directly. This is probably even more maintenance heavy and might or might not work with all / most / some carkits.
This is a great idea. WhatsApp does it, which method does it use?

posts.name: Johanw666
posts.cooked: WhatsApp doesn‚Äôt do it, we tested that when I worked on it. Try answering a WA call with a carkit with separate accept call / reject/hangup call buttons.

It works in my car. I answer and hang up WA calls using my steering wheel buttons frequently. I can also see the call duration on my car LCD. It‚Äôs worked like that for me for years.
I don‚Äôt use Android Auto, just a standard bluetooth connection to my car‚Äôs integrated bluetooth system.

posts.name: Johanw666
posts.cooked: Odd, on the carkits (2) we tested this on (last half of 2017 with the then current WA app) it didn‚Äôt work. Same for Signal and Viber (the plan was eventually that, if it worked, I would decompile the app and analyze the Smali code to see what they did).

Interesting. It‚Äôs been working in my Honda for the past two years. I‚Äôll try it again when I get back home in a few days and see if it still works! Previous to that I had a Parrot bluetooth kit, I think it worked on that also but can‚Äôt remember for sure.

I‚Äôve noticed that after notifications were reworked (5.8), I no longer see double notifications for SMS messages. There now seems to be a separate Signal app and SMS app on the Android auto app list. This means if you get an SMS, it just has a single SMS notification; instead of an SMS and then a duplicate Signal notification (obviously only applies if you use Signal as your default).

I‚Äôm so happy the double notification issue has been solved.

Edit: this actually might be due to a bug. Signal notifications aren‚Äôt coming through at all. Will update with more info.

Update on this issue. Android auto notification support has been temporarily disabled, but will be re-added in the coming versions.

github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android

No notifications on Android Auto

opened 03:35AM - 03 May 21 UTC
closed 03:23PM - 04 Jun 21 UTC
Kage1

- [ x] I have searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [ x] I am submit‚Ä¶ting a bug report for existing functionality that does not work as intended - [ x] I have read https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports - [ x] This isn't a feature request or a discussion topic ---------------------------------------- ### Bug description For several minor revisions now Android Auto is not receiving any notifications of new Signal Messages. One of the beta forum responses is having the same issue. This is over AA wired and AA wireless. It's across at least Android 10 and 11. This appears to have started around Signal Version 5.8.x. https://community.signalusers.org/t/beta-feedback-for-the-upcoming-android-5-10-0-release/31813/37 ### Steps to reproduce - Attach to Android Auto - Receive a new signal message - Notification is received on the device - No notification received on Android Auto **Actual result:** No Notification received in AA **Expected result:** AA should get the notification ### Screenshots ### Device info **Device:** OnePlus 7Pro **Android version:** 11 **Signal version:** 5.10.2 ### Link to debug log https://debuglogs.org/376a2c3b7e558706ae4ae6b43a279979572c63e151fe7821843b9d608f1f9645

Signal desperately needs to support showing calls via Android Auto, especially during the current telecommunications attack in the United States. I‚Äôm trying my best to stick to using Signal calls for communication, but when driving I cannot accept or initiate Signal calls from Android Auto.

If I get a Signal call while using Android Auto, it stops all media playback, doesn‚Äôt even ring, and I can only accept the call from my phone. This is inconvenient and potentially dangerous.
